institution: Human Resources Development Service of Korea
category: Industry-led youth customized training business operation rules/Article 26 (Use of labor costs)
contents: Article 26 (Use of Labor Costs) ① The business group must use the labor costs received as support funds as the labor costs of dedicated personnel pursuant to Article 19 (1) 3 and Annex 5 of the Operational Regulations, including the following cases., 1 Salaries applicable to all workers within the business group, 2. Salaries such as special bonuses stipulated to be paid in the employment contract concluded between the business group and the person in charge, 3. Accumulation of severance benefit reserves to pay severance pay to the person in charge, ② Notwithstanding paragraph 1, the business group cannot use the costs that cooperatives, organizations, and joint training centers must pay among social insurance premiums (national pension, health insurance, employment insurance, industrial accident compensation insurance) as labor costs. ③ The business group cannot use them as labor costs. The details of labor costs used are calculated based on the total amount paid directly to the person in charge during the business fiscal year. However, if the fiscal year is different from the government fiscal year, it is calculated from the monthly wage ledger, etc.
